page.title: 19Joan Rosemary Cobbold Sawle
page.content: Mrs.Rosemary Cobbold Sawle(1891-1971) was the last member of an old Cornish family who had lived at Penrice House, Porthpean for 300 years.She was born a Graves-Sawle and married a colonel Cobbold who was in the army.She dearly loved her home,but was known throug hout the area for her public spirit and her dedication to good works.She was the chief benefactor for many worthy causes,including the addition of a spire to Charlestown church,where she worshipped regularly.Her chief love was old people,however.In her will she left Penrice House to "provide elderly people with a home for the rest of their lives in pleasant surroundings".In the creation of this home for others,her spirit remains alive & carries on its good work.
